chargeHist.descr: Operate Motor Vehicle w/o Owner's Consent
Operating a Motor Vehicle w/o Owner's Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse L. Erickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Motor Vehicle w/o Owner's Consent [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**103 DAYS CREDIT IF REVOKED**

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.

No contact with Co-Defendants Stephanie Shilts, Luke Shilts, or Marty Monhead.
No contact with 3914 Paula Court in Eau Claire.
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold.

Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse L. Erickson

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice returned as undeliverable
Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

Case called at 2:30 PM.
Defendant Jesse L. Erickson in court, in custody with Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Agreement has been reached. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads No Contest to an Amended Count 1: Operate Motor Vehicle w/o Owner's Consent; PTAC. (Without Repeater).
Sentence is Withheld and the Defendant is placed on 2 Years of Probation with the following conditions:
No contact with co-defendants Stephanie Shilts, Luke Shilts, or Marty Monhead. No contact with 3914 Paula Court in Eau Claire. No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. 
Comply with all rules and regulations of Rock Valley Treatment, including being successfully discharged. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Court Costs/surcharges, Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Defendant is granted 103 days of sentence credit.
Plea hearing on October 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

(Case called at 11:09 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Jesse Erickson appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Ryan Kohler. ADA Matthew Kirkpatrick appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and updates Defendant's phone number. State requests $1,000 cash bond- recites failures to appear and reviews facts of case. Defense requests $100 cash bond- Defendant on Probation hold. Court orders $1,000 cash bond with various conditions. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 08/01/2022 at 2:00 PM. 
Hearing: 08/23/2022 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
No contact with H.S.'s residence, co-defendant (L.S.), M.M., S.S., J.G., L.G.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting.
